channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: The people of Gaza are starving and hopes for a temporary ceasefire dashed
item.description: More than two million people living in Gaza are starving and hopes for a temporary ceasefire have been dashed after the U.S. accused Hamas of negotiating in bad faith.

item.title: What to know about network coverage of women's soccer and the Euro Final
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Tamerra Griffin of The Athletic about Sunday's Euro Cup final between Spain and England.

item.title: What's at stake with the European Union-U.S. trading partnership if a tariff deal isn't reached
item.description: As the deadline for the start of 30 percent tariffs on the EU, Cecilia Malmstrom, former European Commissioner for Trade, explains the scope and scale of the EU-US trading partnership and what's at stake if a deal isn't reached.

item.title: What it's like to cover the aftermath of deadly flooding?
item.description: In our latest Reporter's Notebook conversation, we explore what it's like to report on the aftermath of deadly flooding and how it impacts the people who survive.

item.title: As Trump faces continued scrutiny over Epstein, the administration rehashes 2016 Russian interference probe
item.description: During a week of urgent news, the administration has pushed a report on Obama and Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. election. NPR Senior Political Editor and correspondent Domenico Montanaro and Cybersecurity correspondent Jenna McLaughlin unpack the context and timing.

item.title: Artist cancels her exhibition after Smithsonian wants to remove a portrait
item.description: Artist Amy Sherald, who painted Michelle Obama's portrait, has canceled an upcoming exhibition of her work at the Smithsonian's National Portrait Gallery after a dispute.

item.title: What's needed to help historic starvation levels in Gaza is 'tragically simple,' aid group says
item.description: Starvation is plaguing Gaza. We hear about why getting food to the half million people who need it is so difficult.

item.title: British jazz, pop and classical singer Cleo Laine dies at 97
item.description: An appreciation of Dame Cleo Laine, a jazz singer whose evocative phrasing and four-octave range made her among the most celebrated voices in the world.

item.title: France recognizes Palestinian state
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron says France will become the first G7 country to recognize a Palestinian state, drawing praise from Palestinian leaders and sharp condemnation from Israel. Will other nations follow?
